race_name: Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out

top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s olympic peninsula, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out. Make this intensity feel like home.
Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Racing Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s olympic peninsula gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s olympic peninsula gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Unravel - Bon Jon Pass Out requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on olympic peninsula gravel to build confidence. Expect: olympic peninsula, mountain gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 60 miles of olympic peninsula gravel in Quilcene, WA.
